## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
#| message: false
library("tidyverse")
file1 <- read_csv(file = "data/_raw/Reef_Check_with_cortad_variables_with_annual_rate_of_SST_change (1).csv")
file2 <- read_csv(file = "data/_raw/Reef Check Data Raw (1).csv")
```

```{r}
data3 <- read_csv(file="data/_raw/reef_data_combined_tidy.csv")
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data = data3,
       mapping = aes(x = Year,
                     y = Average_bleaching)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x="Year", y="Average_bleaching", title="T1 Scatterplot")
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = data3,
       mapping = aes(x = Year,
                     y = Average_bleaching)) +
  geom_point(alpha=(2)) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE) +
  labs(x="Year", y="Average_bleaching", title="T10 Scatterplot",fill="Ocean",color="Ocean") +
  facet_wrap(~ Ocean)
```

```{r}
library("ggplot2")
ggplot(data = data3 |> filter(Average_bleaching>99.9),
       mapping = aes(x = Year,
                     y = Average_bleaching,
                     fill="Ocean",
                     color="Ocean"
                     )) +
  geom_point() +
  facet_wrap(~ Ocean)  +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") +

  labs(x="Year", y="Average bleaching", title="Something",fill="Ocean",color="Ocean")
```
